channel.title: Need Help Running a RSC Private Server Client - Ubuntu
channel.description:
So, I've searched and found nothing to help me, and I've noticed most of you guys are pretty good a helping people out, so I figured I'd give it a shot to try and get some help.
I'm trying to run, a RSC Private Server Client (.jar) On Ubuntu, but It's throwing this error.
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: /home/bobby/Downloads/LoRSC Client v5 (2)/client/jar Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: .home.bobby.Downloads.LoRSC Client v5 (2).client.jar at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) Could not find the main class: /home/bobby/Downloads/LoRSC Client v5 (2)/client.jar. Program will exit. [/code]
That's me using the java command in Terminal with the .jar file.
Hopefully an easy fix for someone. :D
Edit: The Server is LORSC.com (Legends of Runescape Classic)

item.title: Need Help Running a RSC Private Server Client - Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

create and chmod +x a bash script with the following

#!/bin/bash
java -classpath client.jar:lib/xpp3.jar:lib/xstream.jar:lib/hex-string.jar:lib/jmf.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient

then just type sh yourscript.sh or ./yourscript.sh etc

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help Running a RSC Private Server Client - Ubuntu
